name: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald about the decadence of the Jazz Age.
George Orwell's dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and the dangers of political surveillance.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's timeless story of race, injustice, and morality in the American South.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's novel about a teenager's journey through New York City after being expelled from school.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A beloved romance novel by Jane Austen about love, reputation, and class in early 19th-century England.

name: Moby-Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of obsession and revenge on the high seas.

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's legendary fantasy epic about the quest to destroy the One Ring.

name: Brave New World
description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian vision of a world dominated by technology and social control.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's precursor to The Lord of the Rings, following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

name: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte BrontÃ«'s Gothic romance about a governess who falls in love with her mysterious employer.

name: Fahrenheit 451
description: Ray Bradbury's novel about a future society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn them.

name: Crime and Punishment
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's intense psychological novel about guilt and redemption.

name: War and Peace
description: Leo Tolstoy's sweeping epic about the impact of war on Russian society during the Napoleonic era.

name: The Odyssey
description: Homer's ancient Greek epic about the journey of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's philosophical novel about faith, free will, and the nature of good and evil.
